website_summaries.verdict: One of the most popular vegan cookbooks around, featuring 100 healthy and delicious recipes.
pros: A great selection of family-friendly vegan recipes that require minimal ingredients
Includes beautiful full-page photographs of dishes
Meals are easy to prepare, healthy, and many are designed to please co-habitating carnivores
cons: Book is missing a few well-liked recipes from Liddon's website

customer_reviews.title: Could be okay for a rank beginner
customer_reviews.text: This is a"personality" cookbook and I don't really buy cookbooks to hear about the writer's life. Recipes are meh and few. The recipes she calls AMAZING aren't really, they're just very basic beginner level. I'll be donating it.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie A. Treacher

customer_reviews.title: Major disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Seeing the numbers of reviews for this cookbook I was expecting so much more. Major disappointment. The recipes are pretty boring, lack creativity, the book lacks focus and it failed to impress. The book is pretty big, it also had few pictures of the actual recipes and way too many pictures of the cook, which isn’t really what I am looking for in a cookbook, personally.
customer_reviews.author: Elise P.

customer_reviews.title: Missing pages of entrees
customer_reviews.text: I finally sat down to go through the book to start changing my eating habits. Really like the recipes and they don't seem overly complicated. My biggest problem is the book I received goes from page 137 in the soup section, then the next page is 152 entrees. So missing about 20 pages in the entree section which is kind of an important part of the book. Really disappointing. The page that gives the recipes for the entrees is part of the missing pages so no way to know what they are.
customer_reviews.author: ABB

customer_reviews.title: I found this cookbook to be not very useful or practical
customer_reviews.text: I found this cookbook to be not very useful or practical. When an enchilada recipe took over 3 hrs to put together and I felt like I had to grow my own corn for the tortillas and grow my own beans to purée for the sauce, I accepted that I had wasted my money with this purchase. Switched to a vegetarian cookbook I purchased 20 yrs ago and recipes taste much better and are much simpler to make.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: My current favorite cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I recently changed my lifestyle and eating habits in January 2016, and this book has really inspired me to be more creative with plant based recipes. I absolutely LOVE this book. The recipes are so simple and delicious. Angela's recipes never cease to amaze. Some of my favorites are the oatmeal bakes, overnight oats, enchiladas (I didn't think I liked enchiladas, boy I was wrong!), peanut butter cookie dough bites, tortilla soup, and the best granola clusters I have ever had! Even if you are not vegan, you will truly enjoy these recipes. I also downloaded her app and can't wait for the new book to come out!
customer_reviews.author: Kate the Wild

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book over a year ago after getting more serious about being dedicated to a healthier, plant-based diet, and it is absolutely the best cookbook--vegan, vegetarian, conventional--that I have ever had. I have made about 15 recipes so far, and they are all fantastic. "Life-affirming Warm Nacho Dip" is not to be missed! Every time I've served it at a party, guests jot down the title of the book. I've bought extra copies for new vegans. I've bought several other vegan cookbooks, but recently had an epiphany after a disappointing recipe from one of them: why try any new books until I've exhausted this one? It is that good and that reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t for me
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I did not feel there were many recepies I would use. I was disappointed given all the great reviews I heard about it and the hype but I have honestly no real interest in anything going on in this book. Maybe it’s just me and I am an anomolly but I really wanted to love it and just couldn’t. Still on the hunt for a great cook book if anyone has any suggestions.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: A FANTASTIC COOKBOOK.
customer_reviews.text: The best cookbook. Every recipe bursting with flavor. Some I love so, so much that I would purchase this book just for that recipe alone. I have tried about 40 recipes, and all are fantastic. Great book to learn how to cook vegan, or to impress your dinner guests with. And guys adore what I have cooked, even though they are meat eaters. I love to cook using this book. It is simply amazing. I have her other cookbook as well and it is just as great.
customer_reviews.author: GreenwaterJan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: So very disappointed; didn’t like the feel of the pages, and tried 8 separate recipes - all bland and unappetizing textures. I bought because my very favorite vegan cookbook author RAVED about this one, and there were soooo many excellent reviews .....but was a total miss for our family. I kept for two weeks then passed along.... it didnt spark joy! But to be fair - my mother & father love this book!
customer_reviews.author: ACV03

customer_reviews.title: Picky boyfriend approved
customer_reviews.text: Her recipes are easy and delicious. Even my extremely picky boyfriend wants to eat when I cook her recipes. I have made the creamy curry, creamy tomato soup, avocado pasta, fingerling potatoes with brussel sprouts, the power noodles with spicy peanut sauce and the maple pumpkin pie. I use a high powered blender for most of her recipes, but I think a food processor would be helpful too. I was apprehensive about getting a Kindle cookbook, but I really like it. It's easy to browse recipes and flip to the ones I'm interested in. I can make my shopping lists at work in my down time!
customer_reviews.author: MFriedrich

customer_reviews.title: Stop with the oatmeal recipes!
customer_reviews.text: The highlights of this cookbook are the soups, salads, main entrees and sides. Those are well thought out and delicious. The breakfast section is abysmal with several oatmeal recipes. Oatmeal is the last thing a vegan needs help with! A pancake or French Toast recipe would have been useful. Also, there is a lot of personal filler and details from the author. Personally, I like cookbooks that get to the point with recipes rather than meander like a blog.
customer_reviews.author: mamamama

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality like a photocopy
customer_reviews.text: This isn't an original book. I bought this cookbook for myself before and ordered this one as a gift, it's a bad quality print, the colors aren't as bright, it's a copy of the original book. Don't recommend, buy original in a bookstore
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy, delicious vegan recipes
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this cookbook, as I'm trying to eat a more plant-based diet. It was recommended to me by a friend, who just loves this cookbook. In only one week, and I've already made multiple meals! I'm very new to the vegan world and fairly inexperienced in the kitchen, but most of these recipes look quite easy to make and without too many strange ingredients. Looking forward to trying more!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mains, but a number of "recipes" that don't add anything to the collection.
customer_reviews.text: I've greatly enjoyed the main dishes in this book, but I wish there weren't any breakfast or drink recipes. Those are so simple to make that they shouldn't require any recipe, and I think they're just filler. I'd rather have had more pages devoted to real meals, rather than simple stuff. Otherwise, I'm glad to have purchased this book.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes and photos
customer_reviews.text: I've had this cookbook for about six months and have made something from it almost weekly. Loads of delicious recipes that are not all alike. The walnut/lentil loaf is exceptional - my husband who isn't excited about "eating all plants", liked this better than the meatloaf recipe I'd perfected over the years. I've made it three times (first time seemed to take forever to make, but it got easier once I knew what I was doing!).
customer_reviews.author: Becky80558

customer_reviews.title: Vegan for medical reasons
customer_reviews.text: After being diagnosed with acid reflux and ibs-c, as well as my flare ups leaving me in serious pain, I not only decided to go gluten free but eat vegan as well. Im not creative, so I needed help. What better but to buy then one with a five star rating? I have made 6 recipes so far including the soul soothing African peanut stew and the sunrise scramble. YUM! Vegan? Really??? That is what you will say after tasting her recipes I guarantee it!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Options for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a vegan, my husband is a meat eater by day and plant based by night and our kids are vegetarians, but are too young to really understand. This cookbook is loved by my entire family, including my meat loving parents. It's amazing! The nachos, cashew cream sauce (sour cream), chocolate cake, portobello burgers and portobello fajitas are just a few of our favorites. I've only dislike one recipe (broccoli burritos) and have made 98% of this book. Buy now!
customer_reviews.author: Wch

customer_reviews.title: Who knew vegan could be so good?!!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a vegan, but I bought this book to practice incorporating more plant based protein into my family's meals. It is simple to use and understand. Sometimes vegan cookbooks try to be so fancy. Not this cookbook. I can find almost every ingredient at the local hyvee. I appreciate the variety in the cookbook! I did notice though that when eating vegan, I tended to eat a lot of variety of carbs! It was better than the boring old loaf of bread or cereal. Also the desserts are amazing. My favorite recipe is the power goddess salad!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Vegan simplified!
customer_reviews.text: Simple, easy to follow numbered directions! Not only that, Ms. Liddon gives prep time and cook time. Most of the ingredients are what you already have on hand. There are recipes for a crowd as well as two to four people. Because it's just my husband and myself, this is great. And if you're not totally vegan, there are ways to easily add other ingredients should you choose. And if you're gluten/grain free, there are suggestions for that, too. Everything I've prepared so far has been a hit!
customer_reviews.author: jdayton

customer_reviews.title: The best Vegan and plant-based cookbook I have bought so far!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best vegan, plant-based cookbook I have ever seen! First it has color pics of all the recipes. A must for me. Second in each recipe she says whether it is soy-free, sugar-free, refined sugar- free, gluten -free. I am soy-free and refined sugar-free, so this is another must for me. I already have tons of pages marked to make this coming week after I go pick up some things. Cookies and brownies too that I will be able to eat! Even the smoothies have pics. This book is perfect in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best vegan cookbook I've ever seen!
customer_reviews.text: What I dislike about most cookbooks: they are unrealistic and use obscure ingredients or take an unrealistic amount of time to prepare and cook. This one is none of that! Uses all ingredients I typically or always have on hand, great flavor combos and fantastic recipes that I havent seen before. For a vegan cookbook, it wasnt all power bowls, granola and smoothies...a problem I commonly find in vegan communities. This book is diverse and creative, while using everyday staples of a vegan or vegetarian (or simply a health concious) pantry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You will absolutely love these recipes
customer_reviews.text: Because of this cook book I have become a vegetarian . Angela knows what she is cooking. You will absolutely love these recipes!!!! You will be able to eat healthy , you will ditch your bad cravings and you will be so satisfying. Broccoli&scathed cheese - quinoa burrito, creamy vegetable curry, portobello "steak " fajitas - my husband love it and he is not vegetarian - amazing recipes. If you want to eat more plant based food and you didn't know how to start .....so now you do. Thanks Angela for changing my taste buds :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite cookbook...
customer_reviews.text: I have been transitioning from vegetarian to vegan recently, my husband and daughter have not. However, I purchased and began making food from the Oh She Glows cookbook, and dare say that I have watched them enjoying the food as much as I have. Everything that I have made has been amazing, seriously. Luckily, I have a large spice collection and can understand that this may be burdensome for others without an affinity for collecting such things. However, most of the vegetables are items that I have just sitting around my kitchen that I generally buy on a weekly basis. There are no foods that are unheard of to me which I also found very refreshing.
customer_reviews.author: A. M.

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Recipes!
customer_reviews.text: I first found Angela's website and made several recipes she had posted there, so I was super excited when her cookbook came out. At the time I was eating both meat and dairy, but now have transitioned to a purely plant based diet. Her recipes are delicious and I have loved everything I have made. My kids really like the glow bars, and my favorite recipes are her soups. The best part is I don't miss the meat at all when I make her recipes. Some of the recipes are lengthy but worth the time.
customer_reviews.author: BEL

customer_reviews.title: Great plant based cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Love Angela Liddon's recipes. Her cookbooks have given me the tools I needs to slowly begin my transition to plant based eating. I eat plant based meals 3 days per week. My goal is to fully embrace plant based eating, just need to get my kids and hubby onboard. I've been eating plant based for 3 weeks. Last week, I had a hectic busy week and went back to my old eating habits. It was awful! The stomach pain, the lack of energy, ect. My body told me loud and clear that processed food is not the way to live.
customer_reviews.author: Wife, mommy, and teacher

customer_reviews.title: Good recipes but bad techniques
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the recipes in this book, but the metric weight measurements are way off. I really prefer to use weight instead of volume for baking especially, but can't with this book.
customer_reviews.author: Bookgrrl

customer_reviews.title: My favorite cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook is a must have - especially for the new veganer. I like this book for many reasons, but my favorite is the fact that most of the recipes contain the same ingredients. It saves you money at the store, which is always nice. The recipes are delicious and easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: This cookbook is amazing!! I'm not even vegan but a friend ...
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook is amazing!! I'm not even vegan but a friend made somethings from it that I tried that were just delicious and raved about every recipe she tried! I couldn't wait to order it!
customer_reviews.author: A. Zink

customer_reviews.title: I have enjoyed cooking since I was about 11 years old and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed cooking since I was about 11 years old and got a cookbook for a birthday present. I am now 78. I cook from scratch, bake my own bread, make my own yogurt, sprout my own seeds, yada yada yada...And have browsed cookbooks for years. Not the I follow any recipe in detail but for "ideas...." This one is still worth it now that I am trying to cook far more vegetarian than in the past. If you are looking for one vegetarian/vegan the cookbook, I highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Rimbaud

customer_reviews.title: My favorite cookbook ever
customer_reviews.text: My favorite cookbook ever, by far. I could happily eat just from this cookbook, and a few favorites are weekly menu items in my house. The sweet potato black bean enchiladas are awesome (even meat-eaters agree), and I have also stopped buying packaged granola bars because I make a batch of these every week. I've probably made half the recipes in the book and they have all been delicious and not so incredibly complicated that I'm discouraged before I start. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: hoosier 678

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!!
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed at how delicious each of these recipes are! I am moving towards a plant based diet and wasn't sure what to make other then salads , stir fry and fruit bowls. I just didn't know where to start. I have made five dishes so far and will continue because each recipe is so yummy and flavorful ( I just got the book last week). My husband who is a token meat and Potatos guy is also in awe of these dishes and has been raving about them . So far his favorite is the enchiladas. I absolutely recommend this book to everyone! Not just for vegans!
customer_reviews.author: Lotus Moon 7777

customer_reviews.title: Who knew health could taste soooo good!
customer_reviews.text: Angela Liddon has such a talent for making healthy food tastes great. Her recipes are very doable, with ingredients that are very findable. Every time I try a recipe I’m confident she won’t let me down. Everything I’ve tried so far (about 25% of book) has been wonderful. I also like that she allows for generous portions. Wonderful cookbook, beautiful photos of the pretty, great-tasting, and healthy food!
customer_reviews.author: DeeDee

customer_reviews.title: Delicious, Easy, and No Weird Spices
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this cookbook! I've had it for about a month now and have tried many of her recipes. They are easy and taste great! Some of the recipes do take some prep work the night before (e.g. soaking cashews or beans). I love that none of the recipes call for a spice you rarely use, it's all common food items. You will NOT regret buying this cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: Chahotdog

customer_reviews.title: 3 months meat free because of this book!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this book! I am new to being vegetarian and always struggled with meal prep and making sure I am getting the right nutrients in my diet which always lead me to going back to craving meat. Then I found this book through a friend. It's been 3 months of cooking from this book and I have not craved meat at all and can safely say that I will never eat meat again! These recipes are amazing and so delicious! Even my meat eating husband has become 75% vegetarian because the meals are so satisfying! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Debie Nobles

customer_reviews.title: Library wants it back so had to buy it
customer_reviews.text: I got this cookbook from the library, enjoyed it so much that I renewed it. Now that the second month is almost over I decided I better buy it. Being a vegan with a meat eating redneck boyfriend it is important to offer up filling, flavorful food with "normal" ingredients. No weird vegan stuff here. But these recipes also satisfy my standards for health and well being. I feel wonderful! This book is definitely a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: A top favorite cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when it came out and it is still my favorite cookbook I own! I have been vegetarian for 15 years and I was thrilled to get this book. I love especially how Angela is generous with her spices, where as I feel most are on the weaker side. I make the tex-mex casseroule every time we have company stay with us. The smoothies recpies are great and the soups are delicious. I do recommend this cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: amk

customer_reviews.title: Tasty recipes!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive about purchasing this book because the title was a bit corny and I usually rely of professional chefs, rather than bloggers for cookbooks, but I was pleasantly surprised by how good these recipes are. Liddon's Glo Bars are some of the best I have tasted, and her recipe for a broccoli-quinoa burrito has become one of my all-time favorite recipes. This was a good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Allergy friendly, quick and easy!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a few days ago and absolutely love it! I have made the Maple Cinnamon Apple and Pear Baked Oatmeal, Out the Door Chia Power Doughnuts, Apple Pie Oatmeal, Taco Fiesta Potato Crisps, and Immunity-boosting Tomato Sauce with Mushrooms. In addition to all being vegan, healthy, and gluten free (great for s family with allergies!!), each recipe was quick and easy to prepare and tasted great. Even my teenage boys devoured them!
customer_reviews.author: AngelesHiker

customer_reviews.title: I am surprised by how much I have not enjoyed this cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised by how much I have not enjoyed this cookbook. The pictures are beautiful and I love the layout, but I have not enjoyed the recipes I have used. Perhaps we just have different palates, but I have found a few to just be out of balance, etc. I really wanted to love this but I can't trust the recipes any more.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: YUMMY
customer_reviews.text: I am not vegan, but I really enjoy the recipes in this book. Every one that I have tried has turned out great and flavorful with the exception of one, the avocado chocolate frosting. Avocado + Chocolate = Yuck! It's too bad, because I thought it would be the answer to the non-dairy, and no refined sugar frosting recipe I have been looking for for my daughters first birthday cake. The search continues. Love the 15 minute avocado pasta, the energy bites, the chick pea croutons, the roasted garlic gives a heavenly butters garlic flavor to my lasagna. I have really enjoyed this book and look forward to continuing to try more recipes in it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Audra

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this book on the recommendation of a friend and I am thrilled that I listened to her advice. My husband and I have been trying to eat healthier foods overall, but specifically I have been wanting to reduce our meat consumption. I had been struggling with how to make filling meals that are high in protein without using meats and Angela Liddon answered all of my questions. Her book is detailed and informative while still keeping recipes simple and easy to follow. I haven't been disappointed by a single recipe and I know this will be a staple in my kitchen for years to come. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Olson

customer_reviews.title: Interesting.
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool cookbook. It has tons of great ideas. My only issue is that some of the ingredients, like for the trail mix type bars, is the expensive for all of it. I'm not a vegetarian, but I like a big variety in my food choices. I guess, bottom line, is that I really enjoyed reading it and browsing through the book, but I have yet to use any of the recipes, per se. So...
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous WFPB cookbook for beginners
customer_reviews.text: For health reasons, I changed to a WFPB diet and I like to eat delicious food every day. I chose this cookbook based on reviews and it did not disappoint. Looking through it today, I was surprised to see that I have made almost all of the soup and entree recipes! I loved every single one. Not only that, but I have dropped 12 pounds in two months without even trying while eating my fill every day. I feel better than I have in years. This cookbook rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Easterday

customer_reviews.title: I am not Vegan and LOVE this cookbook.
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook is incredible. I am not vegan and have loved every recipe I have made. You could easily add meat to most of them. The butternut squash recipe is out of this world. It is one of my favorite dishes I have ever ate! The lemon avocado pasta is soooo yummy too. I have enjoyed cooking with this. All the recipes are healthy and I love that. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: i think this may be my new very favorite cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: i think this may be my new very favorite cookbook!! the recipes are clear and easy...with ingredients that if youre buying a vegan book, you probably already have around lol! im not vegan but mostly vegetarian and i love this book. if you choose to tweak anything its very easy to do and the food that ive made with this book has all been excellent! the pictures are great as well!!
customer_reviews.author: AmyJ

customer_reviews.title: she makes it easy, fun
customer_reviews.text: she did everything she could. i couldn't really keep up with the vegan diet, but i did it for much longer than I would have because of this book. she makes it easy, fun, and the food tastes good. absolutely worth trying. any maybe you'll stick with it longer than i could! do, because vegans are right - eating meat really does not make a lot of environmental or dietary sense.
customer_reviews.author: HD

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Recipes
customer_reviews.text: I got a copy for my niece and liked it so much I got one for myself. I make things from it weekly. We are omnivorous flexitarians at our house and follow plant based eating most of the time. We do eat meat and do so responsibly by buying from humane sources, farmers and producers. This book makes eating vegan a more daily occurrence because it all tastes so good and is really easy to follow. Thank you! Check out her blog as well!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Truhan

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful cookbook if your starting your plant based meals or if your already vegan and just need some new ideas. Everything is explained really well and she laid it out perfectly, i recommend making tabs for the sections so you can find what your looking for easier (it’s a pretty big book this helps divide it and she already has it sectioned out).
customer_reviews.author: Destiny Proudfoot

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Resource!
customer_reviews.text: I have never picked up a recipe book and wanted to try everything in it...UNTIL NOW! I love this book. The author does a great job of giving a pantry list of common items and the recipes are easy, allergy and sensitivity friendly, and have simple, whole, easy to acquire ingredients. If you are vegan and gluten free (or want to be) you will also like this book. If you are just wanting to explore good plant based foods...you will also like this book.
customer_reviews.author: FWMame

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyed them all
customer_reviews.text: Have tried several recipes including--Kale Chips, Luxurious Tomato-basil Pasta, Pan-seared garlic tofu. Enjoyed them all. Photos are clear, appetizing and located next to the recipe. Some of the titles to the recipes are a tad cutesy (On the Mend Spiced Red Lentil-Kale Soup, Empowered Noodle Bowl....)--but I don't care since the food is delicious.
customer_reviews.author: L J

customer_reviews.title: Most people I know lift a corner of their lips in disgust. When friends eat these tasty meals prepared from ...
customer_reviews.text: I feel strange calling myself a vegan. So I don't. Most people I know lift a corner of their lips in disgust. When friends eat these tasty meals prepared from The Oh She Glows Cookbook, they sing a different tune. "I don't even miss the meat", they say. I Have lost 45 pounds. Thank you Angela Liddon. My energy level is, let me see, how do I put this in words? I only need one. WOW! Well one more word. FUN! Oh Wait. TASTY!
customer_reviews.author: katie benson

customer_reviews.title: Weekly Go-To
customer_reviews.text: We have several vegetarian cookbooks, and this is the best one of all. We're not vegan, but mostly vegetarian. Everything I've made from this book turns out well, even the ones of which I was slightly skeptical. Some of the ethnic recipes are probably watered down, but the recipes don't shy away from using spices, and I love that. There's a good mix of more labor-intensive and less labor-intensive recipes - and everything's nutritious and tasty. Our weekly go-to recipes come from here.
customer_reviews.author: gd320

customer_reviews.title: This cookbook has been my favorite for the last two years
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook has been my favorite for the last two years. Every single recipe that I have made has been delicious! When I have a family event to attend, I usually always make something from this book. The balsalmic vinegrette dressing is amazing. The 10 spice vegetable soup is delicious and I make it at least a few times a month. The homemade veggie broth, apple pie oatmeal, out the door chia donughts, portabello salad and festive kale salad are all a few of my favorites. Every recipe has a beautiful picture next to it too! Would highly recommend adding this to your cookbook collection!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A. Wirsing

customer_reviews.title: Great Variety of Recipes!
customer_reviews.text: There are some EXCELLENT recipes in this book! I am very impressed with the amount of recipes for the book price, as well as the variety of dishes included in the book. I have made 4 recipes so far (only had the book for <2 weeks) and all of them have been fantastic! I have also been able to successfully modify some of the recipes for my non-vegan husband. Overall, Angela put together a great collection of recipes, and I am looking forward to trying many more of them!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Picard

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Vegetarian Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: There are lots of great recipes in here. One that I'm planning on making soon is the Creamy Avocado Potato and Asparagus Salad. It also has a Tex-Mex Casserole, Broccoli and Cashew Cheese-Quinoa Burrito, Creamy Avocado Pasta, Chickpea Salad Sandwich, Taco Fiesta Potato Crisps, a Veggie Burger, Chocolate Zucchini Muffins, Soups, Salads, Smoothies and Drinks, and lots more . I love that it has super nice pictures in color.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie37

customer_reviews.title: The original and probably best Intro to Vegan Cooking
customer_reviews.text: Everything in this book is so good. I've made almost everything in here and it's healthy, tasty, and honestly pretty simple cooking. She makes food that actually tastes good. Great for transitioning to a vegan diet, or just for those looking to try out some new meat-free recipes. My copy is almost so worn from use that I'll need a new one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jessb

customer_reviews.title: Some of the best recipes I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I could write a novel how much I love this book. However, I will just keep it to this: Angela is one of the most talented people I have come across. She is an absolute artist when it comes to making healthy food that tastes better than the alternative. In fact, this book alone is what convinced me I could become vegan. Whenever I have friends over for dinner, I make something from this book and they CANNOT believe it's vegan. It's such a game changer. Completely worth the money and I will be buying her next book the day it comes out. You must get this - especially if you love to eat well and be healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Eyre

customer_reviews.title: Wholesome Meals
customer_reviews.text: This vegan cook book is nice, the recipes are all very natural. There is no "funky" ingredients and it is not soy based like some vegetarian recipe books. The book itself is well constructed, the pages and print are very nice quality. I ordered this book after finding the authors food blog on the internet. It peaked my interest since I was looking for more non-soy menu options. Some of these recipes are very tasty. This book had a lot of recipes for smoothies, but I haven't tried any of those. This book is very nice for someone that wants simple no fuss meals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon for EVERYTHING

customer_reviews.title: A cookbook for your whole family to enjoy
customer_reviews.text: I just received this cooked book a few weeks ago and have tried quite a few recipes. The secret to a good cookbook is Picture on how the food should look Easy instructions to follow Ingredients that are common and in your cabinet End result is good for family
customer_reviews.author: shopinful

customer_reviews.title: My favorite cookbook
customer_reviews.text: At last, a cookbook I actually use! An excellent resource for everyone, but especially for people with dietary restrictions looking for something delicious and different to eat. I don't like to cook, but these recipes are easy to follow and presented in a flexible way that even I find interesting and fun. Plus, they always taste great. Since I started using Angela Lidden's cookbook, I've actually been told "your skin glows" more than once --- great to hear when you're in your middle-50s :)
customer_reviews.author: ToniJo

customer_reviews.title: Even non vegans will love the pop of flavors
customer_reviews.text: I always recommend this book to people who are trying to incorporate more veggies into their diet but don't want to compromise on good flavors. My hubby and I are not vegan, but just trying to eat healthier. Every recipe I have made has been wonderful--from the garbanzo bean "tuna" salad, to the avocado pesto. Out of all the books on my cook book shelf, this one is the most bent, dripped on and loved.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Friedland-Smith

customer_reviews.title: Vegan foods made DELICIOUSLY!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS RECIPE BOOK! If you're trying to go vegan, or simply want to reduce the amount of animal products you consume, this is an ecellent place to start. Angela gives several pages on the basics of vegan cooking and the ingredients she uses in many of the recipes. Laid out in a logical format with lots of photos will help you decide which ones to try first. My favorites are the overnight oatmeal, creamy tomato and cashew soup, and the meatless meatloaf. Very good!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: This one's a winner!
customer_reviews.text: After reading The China Study, I made a decision to experiment with Veganism. Time and time again, I would be vegan for a few days, and go back to eating animal products out of convenience. Needless to say, I decided I had to try something else, so I bought his book. I cracked it open and compiled a shopping list for the meals I wanted to make first. Today, I made the Cheesy-Broccoli Quinoa Burrito and MAN WAS IT GOOD. It was creamy and rich, yet light at the same time. Not only was it extremely delicious, but it was very easy to make. I cannot wait to try the other recipes!
customer_reviews.author: A. Flores

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: I use a lot of Angela's recipes from her blog, some are only in the book. VOO rocks! Some desserts with too much sugar, but you can work with them to reduce. LOVE that she mentions alternates for those of us sensitive to soy and eggs (she does for gluten too but I don't have a gluten allergy). Simple recipes a 9 year old can make most of them. She warns to read thru the entire recipe to be sure you have the ingredients, which I recommend. I'm not Vegan, and appreciate the lack of proselytizing while expounding the health benefits and beauty of wholesome eating.
customer_reviews.author: OmChi4Me

customer_reviews.title: I find more useful vegan recipes for free on the Internet
customer_reviews.text: It has pretty pictures, which is always nice in a cookbook, and it is well written. However, I think there are maybe three recipes in here I will make with any regularity, which surprised me because I find recipes on her blog frequently. I wish I had saved the money and just used her blog.
customer_reviews.author: A.B.Reader

customer_reviews.title: So many good recipes
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe how many recipes I was inspired to make out of this book. This book has made cooking fun again. Everything is very healthy but also beautiful and tasty. I have to remind myself this is a vegan cookbook because I certainly do not miss the meat or dairy in these recipes. I never intended to go vegan but it would be easy with recipes like this. The narrative, directions and photos of each recipe make this a delightful and inspiring book. Some recipes might at first glance seem to have a lot of ingredients but often its just many spices, which once you buy, you already have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth M. Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Full of great recipes
customer_reviews.text: Whether you are vegan or not, this is a great cookbook. I've made many of the recipes for my non-vegan friends, and they love them...the enchilada recipe is wonderful. I made competing enchiladas (the sweet potato/black bean one from this book and a chicken one from another) - while both were wonderful, the preferred version was definitely the one from this book (even for my father, a meat & potatoes man). I've had this book for years - definitely a worthwhile addition to your cookbook collection.
customer_reviews.author: SLS

customer_reviews.title: So Happy I Tried This!
customer_reviews.text: I am so impressed with this cookbook! I am in the middle of transitioning to a plant-based diet, and Angela's recipes have so far been amazing, each and every one I've tried. I also love that she has a section where she talks about different ingredients she uses that some people (like myself) might not be too familiar with. I like this cookbook so much, I'm buying another one to send to my mom. If you're wanting healthy and delicious new recipes, definitely buy this book!
customer_reviews.author: HFrantz

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this recipe book
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this recipe book!!! Lot of color photos, the recipes are great, food is delicious!!!! Would definitely recommend! The thing I like the most is there is picture for each of recipe! This is essential, most important thing to me when it come to recipe book!
customer_reviews.author: Fred & Leonna

customer_reviews.title: I must say that we have enjoyed the many recipes in this book and we highly ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband has had IBS all his life. We changed our eating habits by first eliminating meat altogether and slowly began the road of eliminating dairy products as much as possible as his IBS was acting up again. Then I discovered this cookbook in August. I read that Angela also had suffered from IBS all her life too. My husband perked up after hearing this and was very much interested in trying out the recipes. I must say that we have enjoyed the many recipes in this book and we highly recommend this cookbook as not only does it contain great recipes but great Tips as well. Everything tastes so good!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Diane

customer_reviews.title: And the book is easy to read
customer_reviews.text: I am always skeptical about vegan cookbooks. Usually the recipes use one veggie variety (like eggplant) and you soon get sick of the recipes. This book has such variety! And the book is easy to read, having sections for breakfast, mains, sides, smoothies, deserts, snacks WITH PICTURES. She also has a section for staple items such as salsa. I have not made a bad recipe yet and I haven't gotten tired of anything. I am also gluten free and virtually every recipe can be modified. This is the vegan cookbook to buy, especially if you're a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: One of My Go-To Cookbooks
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered this for my Kindle, then ended up buying a hard copy because I use it so much and like having it right there on my shelf, without worrying about whether or not it's charged, lol! (Plus, the photos are GORGEOUS.) I've made a number of these recipes, multiple times, and they've all been delicious. Even my husband, a dedicated carnivore, devours the food I make from this book. Tonight I made the sweet potato and black bean enchiladas, and they were amazing. I like that Ms. Liddon uses fresh ingredients, without meat substitutes. It's food that makes you feel good and energized, rather than sluggish and tired. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Alyzu

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Vegan Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love using this cookbook. The recipes not only taste good, but are healthy and only use regular ingredients, nothing wacky off-the-wall like some vegan books. I've yet to find a bad recipe in here, it's obvious everything was well tested. I also love the substitutions included in most recipes to deal with various allergies, and especially her notes on what DOESN'T work as a substitution (i.e. if only soy milk will work in a recipe, she'll tell you that and why so you don't waste time using almond milk and then wondering why it didn't gel properly). I can't recommend this highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Tim M

customer_reviews.title: I love this cookbook and rely on it and the blog ...
customer_reviews.text: I've done about 6 recipes so far. I love this cookbook and rely on it and the blog often to make veganism not just a political choice, but a healthier one too. I've truly enjoyed cooking with my partner from this book, especially the sweet potato enchiladas and the creamy avocado pasta. Looking forward to trying the granola recipes for my upcoming camping trip. The minor downsides: recipes can be complicated, and the prep time is really not indicative of the prep time of beginner/intermediate cooks who are learning to be vegan. With two people, A recipe that supposedly takes 50 minutes takes us two hours. Still, well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Irene M

customer_reviews.title: Everything I make tastes great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cookbook. I am new to being a vegan and was worried that I'd get bored or hungry. I have loved each recipe I've made from this cookbook. Each meal does take time to prepare (plan on at least an hour from start to finish) but they are well worth it and the leftovers taste even better.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Invigorating book for vegans.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a vegan but my wife started to cut meat from our meals so I bought her this book to cook some nice vegan recipes. I did not know we could cook this many different dishes with these ingredients such as Carrot, parsley etc. If you are a vegan and having trouble to think about "what to cook tonight?", this book would be really helpful to you.
customer_reviews.author: Yigit Cinar

customer_reviews.title: Torn out pages!!!
customer_reviews.text: Well I love the cookbook, no question. Sad for me I purchased it in August (it's October) and there are 4 pages missing!! And wouldn't you know it's be there recipe I want! Luxurious Tomato-Basil pasta. Such a bummer. Check pages of you order LIKE NEW BOOKS. this one is not.
customer_reviews.author: Libby58

customer_reviews.title: Great Recipes!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't found a recipe in this book that I didn't like. My vegan granddaughter brought hers when she visited. Great bonding experience to be able to cook together in the kitchen. Even Hubby who is all Carnivore absolutely loves the Cauliflower Mashed Potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Delgado

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS COOKBOOK, also NOT a vegan
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY LOVE this COOKBOOK. I am a complete omnivore. I never met a calorie I didn't like. This is so healthy, delicious, CREATIVE, unique. I get almost all ingredients from Trader Joes. I am buying multiple copies to give to friends, because it's a gift of health! This food is amazing. Eat better!
customer_reviews.author: busy_mom

customer_reviews.title: great everyday vegan cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to cookbook for family dinners. The recipes are uncomplicated and delicious with ingredients that most of us plant-based eaters have on hand. I'd say it's probably great for someone who is trying to convert to a plant-based diet as well. There are some great recipes for large crowds too. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: A. Tomlinson

customer_reviews.title: Amen! Alleluia!
customer_reviews.text: My new vegetarian bible. Beautiful enough to be a coffee table book. Filled with wonderful recipes to please the palette, feed the soul, and nourish the body. I’m not even a vegetarian, but these recipes are winning me over. My not-so-health-conscious teens are amazed how the recipes taste.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: I have made several recipes from this book so far and they've all turned out delicious! I love that I already have most of the ingredients on hand and the instructions are easy to follow. It's also nice to have a beautiful color photo for each recipe!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael S.

customer_reviews.title: Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I was pescetarian, but have since become vegan. This is one of my absolute favorite vegan cookbooks! Everything I've made has been a hit. My husband, who never liked soup, requested the "10-Spice Vegetable Soup with cashew cream" and the "On the Mend Spiced Red Lentil-kale Soup" all winter! Other favorites are the "Lentil-Walnut Loaf" and the "Walnut, Avocado & Pear Salad with Marinated Portobello Caps & Red Onion." Even meat eaters will love the recipes in this book!
customer_reviews.author: Missa

customer_reviews.title: Buy this cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: I've made many of Angela's recipes from her blog so I knew the recipes in her cookbook would be tasty. I wasn't disappointed. This is a fantastic cookbook with no room for improvement. It's beautiful. Every recipe has a gorgeous picture. The recipes are delicious for anyone but especially delightful additions for vegans/vegetarians/gluten-free folks. It's also super helpful for those who may not be familiar with the some of the ingredients Angela uses because she included a pantry guide and kitchen guide which describe the whats, whys and hows of the ingredients she uses. It's only available in softcover so I'm planning on laminating the cover asap, because this book is going to be getting a lot of use!
customer_reviews.author: Kermit fan

customer_reviews.title: A must-have cookbook for the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I rarely order cookbooks anymore: they take up space in our (small) kitchen, and there is such a wealth of recipes online I usually don't have a compelling reason. But this cookbook is worth having. It has a variety of delicious recipes, most of which it seems are different than what's on the Oh She Glows blog. All the ones I've tried are dishes I'd be happy to serve to guests (or scarf down by myself because they're so good). My only wish is that the book had "lay flat" pages, rather than a traditional paperback spine. But, I just find something heavy to hold down the pages, and continue making the amazing recipes inside. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: 6bluefreckles

customer_reviews.title: Now I Glow Too!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Cookbook for Plant -Based eating! Includes an explanation of what plant-based means, protein sources, and basic pantry items in addition to recipes sorted by category! I was new to this type of menu and “Oh She Glows” set me up for success!
customer_reviews.author: Patty Clancy

customer_reviews.title: Easy for starting out vegan
customer_reviews.text: I had been following Angela Liddons' we site for several month and really enjoyed her approach to becoming /being vegetarian. Angela explains her journey to a vegetarian way of eating. She is not judgmental with suggestions, instead encouraging small steps in approaching changes. Her recipes are easy and do not call for difficult to find ingredients. Main dishes, salads, and my favorite COOKIES, are all covered. Thanks to Angela , I can now make my own almond milk which is so much better than store bought! I would recommend this book to anyone one interest in making some easy healthy changes in their diet , even if not wanting to be come a vegetarian.
customer_reviews.author: cookie baker

customer_reviews.title: Best Cookbook Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best cookbook ever! Received it as a gift from my sister in-law and it has such wonderful recipes that I purchased two more books to give as gifts. It may be a cookbook aimed at vegan or vegetarians but my husband, who is a meat eater, still loved all the dishes I've prepared. You won't be disappointed purchasing this cookbook, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven C

customer_reviews.title: Angela has obviously put a lot of time and energy into testing her recipes and it is much appreciated because when you can have
customer_reviews.text: This is vegan bible as far as I am concerned! The recipes are foolproof, just follow the directions and you're in for a treat. Angela has obviously put a lot of time and energy into testing her recipes and it is much appreciated because when you can have the confidence that a recipe is going to turn out wonderfully every time, that's priceless! Love love love this book<3
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Ward

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully done!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a wonderful cookbook for anyone who is serious about eating healthy. Some of the recipes are a little time consuming if your not used to cooking from scratch, but for most they are all pretty simple. The snacks are great (power bars, roasted chickpeas, kale chips, eat...). Most of the smoothies are very good, the detox soup is awesome, and the veggie burgers are so good. Would highly recommend you put this on your cookbook shelf 😊
customer_reviews.author: L.A.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great book for newbies to get their feet wet with ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book for newbies to get their feet wet with starting to cook with whole foods and keeping recipes plant-based. Angela lays out the ingredients she loves and cookware she finds works the best for her. I like the recipes because they are easy to understand not too many ingredients and most importantly taste delicious. Her story in similar to mine and I appreciate her self-taught methods to fantastic food! Buy this book you'll love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Brown

customer_reviews.title: My favorite cookbook! I think j can honestly say I ...
customer_reviews.text: My favorite cookbook! I think j can honestly say I haven't found a recipe that didn't work or didn't taste amazing. I've been following the blog for years. I loved the simple, real ingredients. The results were even better. The broccoli and cheese burritos are to die for. The chia donuts were gone in 15 minutes. The breakfast muesli was a hit with my kids - I even had to eat some and I'm not a breakfast person at all. The 10-spice veggie soup is soooooo delicious I make it every single week. You will not by disappointed by this book! And for the record I'm not a vegan, but this really helps me and my family eat our veggies!
customer_reviews.author: Angelina J.

customer_reviews.title: great for beginner Vegans.
customer_reviews.text: Took one star off because I wish there was a few more entrée recipes. And I do agree with other reviewers, the author couple have subbed some of the pictures of herself with more pictures of the actual food. But the recipes I tried so far were good. Great vegan cookbook to have at your disposal.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Food, that is good for you!
customer_reviews.text: I will spend years perfecting the recipes in this book. My whole family is glowing from the amazing, flavorful, healthy meals we are enjoying. I have ordered three more copies to give to friends and family. Dog eared and well loved. This may be my favorite cookbook; if not my favorite, then one of the top three!!! I cannot recommend it highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Delicous and easy
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant at first to buy this, because I have several other vegan cookbooks that I was using to transition from vegetarian to vegan. But, I am so glad I did. I did not have have to buy anything special because I already had all the ingredients. I was amazed at how simple and easy it was to make delicious food and drinks. I love everything I make out of this and it has become my favorite cookbook. Highly recommend to anyone interested in a plant-based lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: Meesha

customer_reviews.title: The oh she glows!
customer_reviews.text: First time found her blog and was a follower,once she came out with her book,i purchased imediatly,as i was inyo healthy lifestyle and healthy recepies.The book is beautiful and well written,lots of healthy recepies with gorgeous colorful pictures,that just makes you so hungry lol..I recommend to purchase a book if you trying to add some new and healthy recepies to your lifestyle, you wont be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: natallia. ***(Primer Member)**

customer_reviews.title: Good recipes for established vegans
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not a book for very early/beginner vegans. Once you really have your pantry staples figured out and are looking for good new flavors and variety get this. I love the recipes and now as an established vegan found that I already had many of the ingredients I had previously been intimidated by.
customer_reviews.author: PWNP

customer_reviews.title: Recommended to me by two friends
customer_reviews.text: Recommended to me by two friends, and boy were they right. As someone who's a veteran cook, I am skeptical of vegan recipes in part because of meat substitutes, most of which I find unpalatable. Liddon is right on - everything I've made from here is superb. The sweet potato-black bean enchiladas may be my favorite recipe of all time. Now it's my job to convert others to this cookbook!
customer_reviews.author: euonymous

customer_reviews.title: My favorite cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this cookbook for several months and it is easily my most used and most loved cookbook. I have tried a little over 50% of the recipes and have yet to find a recipe I did not enjoy. I love that the recipes are vegan and have a gluten free option. My families' favorite recipes that I make regularly are Maple cinnamon Apple & Pear Baked Oatmeal, Classic Hummus, 10 Spice Vegetable Soup with Cashew Cream, Crowd-Pleasing Tex-Mex Casserole, Lentil Walnut Loaf, Luxurious Tomato Basil Pasta, and oil Free Chocolate Zucchini Muffins. I have made several of these recipes for non vegan company and everyone always raves about what I make. I highly recommend this cookbook!
customer_reviews.author: J. Prentice

customer_reviews.title: Not many recipes I would like. Good for someone who is into this type ...
customer_reviews.text: Recipes have a lot of ingredients that are hard to find or ones that I would not use that much. Not many recipes I would like. Good for someone who is into this type of cooking. Just not for me. Gave to my sister-in-law. She loves it. So there you go. Good and bad.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

product_meta.title: The Oh She Glows Cookbook: Over 100 Vegan Recipes to Glow from the Inside Out
